content.description: Start up a short hand sized crack which quickly widens into a chimney system that curves up and left at the top.
content.location:
Obvious wide crack on the far left side of the southeast face and just right of

Knightline

.

content.description:
Climb featured face to the top of a block and continue up another block with a thin crack to reach a ledge at about the halfway point. Above the ledge face holds gain a left-slanting crack which leads to the anchors.

* As an alternative it's possible to climb a crack to the left or the right of the ledge halfway at no increase in difficulty.
content.protection:
TR from anchors atop

The Murder Hole
content.location:
Located between

Taj

and

The Murder Hole

.

content.description:
From the bottom of Knightline, follow the hand crack up and slightly right. About halfway up it splits into two; keep right to a nice belay ledge on top.

Belay from the top, then walk right to rap rings on top of Round Table.
content.location: Hand crack to the right of Knightline.

content.description: Climb a thin crack/juggy arete just right of some jumbled blocks to a large horn just right of the first pine tree and then switch into the clean splitter hand crack which passes through a steep section to the right of the second pine tree. Finishes on a large ledge with anchors.
content.location: Center of the southeast face and just right of two prominent pine trees growing out of the rock.

content.description: Climb up and over stacked blocks to enter a wide chimney system with cracks in the back. Work up passing along the left side of two small pine trees and finish with a section of offwidth at the top.

The first bolt is about 40 feet up but you can place gear on easy 5.8+ cracks to the first bolt if you don't feel comfortable running it out. The crux is found when you have to pull the roof although you have very good hands and a bolt right at your waist. The final crux is moving to the last bolt kind of a tricky slab move on thin hands. This one is rope stretcher a 60 m rope was not long enough to lower all the way to the ground.
content.protection: 10 bolts and medium to small cams, 2 bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: This route is hard to miss it follows a prominent corner up to a cool looking roof.

content.description: Climbs the undulating wide crack with lots of face holds to the top of a block and then up the featured right side of the upper headwall.
content.location:
Just right of

Crocs in the Moat

.

content.description:
Lieback up an easy wide crack to start with no protection (optional 6 inch piece) then continue up easy face to a hand/fist crack on the right side of a stembox which you can stem, jam, lieback and face climb to a belay atop the Black Tower and shared anchors with the

Black Tower Crack

.
content.location: This is the rightmost line on the southeast face and climbs along the left side of the Black Tower to a belay atop it.

content.description:
Start up a thin crack right of

Round Table

and head for an obvious curving thin crack in a block. Once atop the block head left and climb the left edge of the upper headwall to anchors on a ledge.

* Most of this route is fairly good but the upper section is contrived as you end up climbing so near the obvious crack of

Round Table

to keep it at grade as well as near your gear.
Start by climbing over a boulder into a slot. Then climb the crack into a couple fun chimney moves at the top.
content.protection: Nuts and cams. A number 4 Camelot can be handy but isn't necessary.
content.location: Rap off two bolt anchors from the final ledge.
